name: Senior Frontend Developer (Accounts Team, Remote)
description:
Access Softek started developing software 30 years ago in Berkeley, California. We have offices all over the United States, Canada, and around the world, and we are growing by the day. Our software is used by over 350+ financial institutions, helping them reach millions of customers and shape their communities.

The banking software department is looking for a Senior Front-end Developer.

With the Accounts team, you will be building custom solutions for US-based financial institutions including mobile applications for Android and iOS and web applications using React + TypeScript/JavaScript. Creation and implementation of a web UI design system and the development of a Web UI using our own custom UI components library.

This is an opportunity to know more about financial technologies and system architecture patterns, as well as the ability to work closely with modern Front-end approaches.

This position is remote, full-time, and requires some periodic overlap with Pacific daytime hours.

Primary responsibilities

  • Writing code with built-in quality - identify and analyze corner cases, design and implement unit and integration tests, participate in building API and end-to-end tests
  • Automate the build and deployment of your code to the infrastructure
  • Develop and support UI components using React framework
  • Participate in code reviews
  • Hold an active position on delivering the results of your work to production, and actively collaborate with your team members and stakeholders to make sure all necessary details are covered

Required skills and qualifications

  • 5+ years of web application development experience
  • Strong knowledge of ECMAScript 5+ and TypeScript
  • Strong knowledge of design patterns, best practices, technologies (OOP, MVC/MVVM, REST, SPA, AMD), and async workflows (promises, async/await)
  • Good experience with one of the modern JS frameworks (React, Angular, Vue.js, or Svelte)
  • Experience with Node.js and JS build tools (Webpack, Gulp)
  • Experience building web applications that have good separation of concerns, proper layers of abstraction, containment, and reusable components
  • Strong knowledge and experience with API protocols (REST, GraphQL)
  • Strong skills in HTML/CSS and CSS preprocessors (LESS/SASS/PostCSS)
  • Good understanding of UI/UX designs best practices
  • Familiarity with web security best practices
  • Excellent problem-solving and debugging skills
  • Familiarity with DVCS (git or hg)
  • Strong team player with 'can do' attitude and good time management skills
  • Good understanding of Agile methodologies, like Scrum
  • Intermediate English (ability to read and write) or above

Nice to have

  • Understanding concepts of distributed systems design and cloud computing
  • Knowledge or hands-on experience with building parts of the AWS platform (S3, CloudFront, Lambda, and others)
  • Familiarity with C#.NET/C#.NET Core or ASP.NET/ASP.NET Core stacks and development on Windows
  • Some basic understanding of Docker and containers

Our benefits

  • Flexible working hours
  • Experienced development teams
  • Relocation compensation package to be discussed individually
  • Long-term employment
  • Competitive salary
  • Paid vacation and days off on national holidays
  • Paid sick leave and internal medical insurance policy
  • Mental health coverage
  • Compensation for training and additional education
  • Provision of computer equipment
  • Internet compensation (50$ per month)
